meanings.definition: Treat (a person or animal) with cruelty or violence.
meanings.sent1: The bully was maltreating the smaller kids on the playground.
meanings.sent2: The animal shelter rescued a dog that had been maltreated by its previous owner.
meanings.sent3: The villain in the movie was always maltreating his henchmen for no reason.
meanings.sent4: The storm was maltreating the fragile flowers in the garden, bending them with its strong winds.
meanings.sent5: The news report showed shocking footage of workers maltreating the farm animals.

meanings.sent1: Be careful not to maltreat the delicate equipment when moving it.
meanings.sent2: The old books were maltreated by being left out in the rain.
meanings.sent3: The toddler was maltreating the toy truck, banging it against the floor.
meanings.sent4: The chef scolded the new cook for maltreating the fresh ingredients in the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The antique vase was maltreated during shipping, resulting in it being chipped.
